intro: Carronia protensa, commonly known as the Mexican redwood, is a rare and endangered species native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It is a member of the Podocarpaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, cone-like structures that contain its seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Carronia protensa thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
